story.kicker_image_caption: Thank god that datsun has kept the redi-go very close to the concept it showcased a few years back.

mosimage.caption: The dash looks smart and offers ample storage space. The centre console houses a cup-holder and also controls for the front power windows. Driverâ€™s airbag will also be offered. Note the instrument panel which comes straight off the Nissan Micra Active.
Single piece bucket seats are comfortable enough. Overall a roomy cabin.
Datsun redi-Go looks urban but offers 185mm of clearance which is good enough to tackle rural roads.
Pricing of the redi-GO will be key.

story.storykicker: After launching the Go and the Go+, Datsun is betting big on redi-GO, an entry level hatch which will be direct competition to the Renault Kwid
story.storybody:
It is very clear that India is one of the very few markets where car sales are still booming and most of the growth is coming in from the entry-level segment. To tap such a lucrative market is every manufacturer's dream and group company Renault did it with the Kwid a few months back. The success of the Kwid is testimony to the fact that India still craves for cheap and cheerful motors. So to tap into this segment Datsun is all set to launch the redi-GO.

ALSO READ: Nissan banking heavily on Datsun redi-Go success

{mosimage} The redi-GO was first showcased as a concept a few years back and now here is the production version. The good thing is that there is very little difference between the concept and the production version, barring the glitzy bits. The redi-GO is based on the Renault-Nissan CMFA platform which is employed on the Kwid. However from there on the redi-GO is all new. First and foremost it looks radically different from the Kwid. It sports a rakish design which is very adventurous.

The Datsun signature grille sits proudly up front and the swept up headlamps look unique too. In profile the sharpness of the design is evident. Under the skin though the platform has been heavily modified. As a result the redi-GO sports a wheelbase of 2,430mm which is 70mm shorter than the Kwid. {mosimage}

At the same time it is higher and offers marginally more ground clearance at 185mm. It is also shorter than the Kwid and overall designers inform us that the redi-GO is nine per cent smaller than its sibling, the Kwid.

ALSO READ: Datsun redi-Go unveiled, India launch in June

{mosimage} Inside the Datsun brings a breath of fresh air. The dash is smart and offers plenty of cubby holes to place knick knacks. The dash is smart to look at and the controls are within easy reach of the driver. However thanks to the low cost, quality of plastics is not good. The instrument panel comes straight out of the Micra Active and is dominated by a large speedo.

A small digital readout tells drivers about trip, fuel level and rpm along with other tell tales. The driving position is slightly high up and view ahead is clear to the driver. At the back there is space for two and the third one is a bit of a proverbial squeeze.

{mosimage} Power comes from a 799cc, 3-cylinder petrol engine which churns out 54bhp and 72Nm of torque. The engine is mated to a 5-speed manual transmission. Expect the redi-GO to be a rather fuel efficient car. The company is also not ruling out the possibility of offering the redi-GO with a larger 1.0-litre engine and also an AMT version. But all that will come after the 800cc version goes on sale.

ALSO READ: Datsun redi-Go bookings to commence from May 1

Datsun will also offer multiple accessory packages which will be available at dealership and treated as optional extra. So if you like the redi-GO, Datsun will open bookings from May and deliveries will begin in June.
story.magazinekicker: After launching the Go and the Go+, Datsun is betting big on redi-GO, an entry level hatch which will be direct competition to the Renault Kwid
story.shortheadline: Armed with redi-GO, Datsun all set to take on Renault's Kwid
